description: First numerator and then denominator of 1/2-Pascal triangle (by row). To get a 1/2-Pascal triangle, replace "2" in third row of Pascal triangle by "1/2" and calculate all other rows as in Pascal triangle.
links: Peter J. C. Moses, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: fractionalPascal[1,_] = {1}; fractionalPascal[2,_] = {1,1}; fractionalPascal[3,frac_] = {1,frac,1}; fractionalPascal[n_,frac_] := fractionalPascal[n,frac] = Join[{1}, Map[Total, Partition[fractionalPascal[n-1,frac],2,1]],{1}]; Flatten[Map[Transpose,Transpose[{Numerator[#], Denominator[#]}]&[Map[fractionalPascal[#,1/2]&, Range[15]]]]] (* _Peter J. C. Moses_, Apr 04 2013 *)
author: _Mohammad K. Azarian_
